00012 /*********************************************************************************************
00013    'total'
00014 *********************************************************************************************/
00015 #ifndef _FMB_MEM_TRACE_
00016 
00017 /* 'total' contains the "total" sizes allocated (not considering free or realloc!):
00018  * this is a very rough upper bound ... */  
00019 static long long total = 0.0;
00020 
00021 #else 
00022 
00023 /* 'total' contains the size of memory currently allocated, and 
00024  * 'max_total' contains the maximum size of memory allocated during the run of FMB:
00025  * precise, but can induce overhead in CPU times ... */
00026 static long long total = 0.0;
00027 static long long max_total = 0.0;
00028 long long FMB_max_total_memory_allocated(){
00029   return total;
00030 }
00031 
00032 #endif 
00033 
00034 long long FMB_total_memory_allocated(){
00035   return total;
00036 }
00037 void FMB_Add_to_total_memory_allocated(long long size){
00038   total += size;
00039 }

00046 
00047 
00048 
00049 #ifdef _FMB_MEM_TRACE_
00050 /*********************************************************************************************
00051    with _FMB_MEM_TRACE_
00052 *********************************************************************************************/
00053 
00054 /* Should be ok, on 32 bit architectures as well as on 64 bit architectures: */
00055 #define FMB_MEM_ALIGN   64 /* (sizeof(void *)) */
00056 /* Remark: "#define FMB_MEM_ALIGN   16" may be ok on Intel (ix86) architectures ... */
00057 
00058 typedef struct {
00059   int size;
00060 } FMB_mem_header_t;
00061 
00062 /* Computes the number of multiples of 'FMB_MEM_ALIGN' required to store 'FMB_mem_header_t': */
00063 #define FMB_MEM_HEADER_SIZE  (((sizeof(FMB_mem_header_t))+(FMB_MEM_ALIGN-1)) & ~(FMB_MEM_ALIGN-1))
00064 
00065 
00066 
00067 FMB_INLINE void *my_malloc(size_t size){
00068   char *ptr = (char *)malloc(FMB_MEM_HEADER_SIZE + size);
00069 
00070   if(ptr) {
00071     //  fprintf(f_output, " _FMB_MEM_TRACE_ : %i bytes allocated (@ = %p)\n", size, ptr);
00072     ((FMB_mem_header_t *)ptr)->size = size;
00073     ptr += FMB_MEM_HEADER_SIZE;
00074     total += size;
00075     if (total > max_total){ max_total = total; }
00076   }
00077 
00078   return ptr;
00079 }
00080 
00081 FMB_INLINE void my_free(void *ptr){
00082   if(ptr) {
00083     (char *)ptr -= FMB_MEM_HEADER_SIZE;
00084     
00085     //    fprintf(f_output, " _FMB_MEM_TRACE_ : free %i bytes (@ = %p)\n", ((FMB_mem_header_t *)ptr)->size, ptr);
00086     total -=  ((FMB_mem_header_t *)ptr)->size;
00087     free(ptr);
00088   }
00089 }
00090 
00091 
00092 FMB_INLINE void *my_calloc(size_t nmemb, size_t size){
00093   size_t size_to_allocate = size*nmemb; /* WARNING: may cause problem for too high value of 'size*nmemb' ... */
00094   char *ptr = (char *)calloc(1, FMB_MEM_HEADER_SIZE + size_to_allocate); 
00095 
00096   if(ptr) {
00097   //  fprintf(f_output, " _FMB_MEM_TRACE_ : %i bytes allocated (@ = %p)\n", size_to_allocate, ptr);
00098     ((FMB_mem_header_t *)ptr)->size = size_to_allocate;
00099     ptr += FMB_MEM_HEADER_SIZE;
00100     total += size_to_allocate;
00101     if (total > max_total){ max_total = total; }
00102   }
00103 
00104   return ptr;
00105 }
00106 FMB_INLINE void *my_realloc(void *ptr, size_t size){
00107   size_t previous_size;
00108   char *new_ptr;
00109 
00110   if(ptr) {
00111     (char *)ptr -= FMB_MEM_HEADER_SIZE;
00112     previous_size = ((FMB_mem_header_t *)ptr)->size;
00113   }
00114   else {
00115     previous_size = 0;
00116   }
00117   
00118   new_ptr = (char *)realloc(ptr, FMB_MEM_HEADER_SIZE + size); 
00119 
00120   if (new_ptr){
00121     if (size > previous_size){
00122       //    fprintf(f_output, " _FMB_MEM_TRACE_ : %i bytes (re)allocated (@ = %p)\n", size - previous_size, ptr);
00123       total +=  size - previous_size;
00124       if (total > max_total){ max_total = total; }
00125     }
00126     /* I do nothing if (size <= previous_size), but the libc may do something! 
00127      * This is however implementation dependant ... */
00128 
00129     new_ptr += FMB_MEM_HEADER_SIZE;
00130   }
00131 
00132   return new_ptr;
00133 }

00149 FMB_INLINE void *my_malloc(size_t size){
00150   void *ptr = (void *)malloc(size);
00151 
00152   if(ptr) { total += size; }
00153   return ptr;
00154 }
00155 
00156 FMB_INLINE void my_free(void *ptr){
00157   free(ptr);
00158 }
00159

00161 FMB_INLINE void *my_calloc(size_t nmemb, size_t size){
00162   char *ptr = (char *)calloc(nmemb, size); 
00163   
00164   if(ptr) {total += size; }
00165   return ptr;
00166 }
00167 FMB_INLINE void *my_realloc(void *ptr, size_t size){
00168   char *new_ptr = (char *)realloc(ptr, size); 
00169 
00170   if (new_ptr){ total += size; }
00171   return new_ptr;
00172 }

00185 /*********************************************************************************************
00186    misc. functions
00187 *********************************************************************************************/
00188 void *malloc_with_check(size_t size){
00189   void *ptr = NULL;
00190 
00191   if (size == 0){ 
00192     FMB_error("In malloc_with_check(): size == 0\n");
00193   }
00194 
00195   if ((ptr = my_malloc(size)) == NULL){
00196     FMB_perror("In malloc_with_check(size=%i) (memory already allocated (WARNING! This value is not thread-safe!): %f Mo)", size, (REAL_T) total / (1024 * 1024));
00197   }
00198   SEVERAL_PROCS_DEBUG_DISPLAY(2, fprintf(f_output, "total_mem_allocated = %.1f MB\n", (REAL_T) total / (1024*1024)););
00199 
00200   return ptr;
00201 }
00202 
00203 
00204 void *calloc_with_check(size_t nmemb, size_t size){
00205   void *ptr = NULL;
00206 
00207   if ((size == 0) || (nmemb == 0)){ 
00208     FMB_error("In calloc_with_check(): size == 0 || nmemb == 0 \n");
00209   }
00210 
00211   if ((ptr = my_calloc(nmemb, size)) == NULL){
00212     FMB_perror("In calloc_with_check(size=%i) (memory already allocated (WARNING! This value is not thread-safe!): %f Mo)", size, (REAL_T) total / (1024 * 1024));
00213   }
00214   //  SEVERAL_PROCS_DEBUG_DISPLAY(2, fprintf(f_output, "total_mem_allocated = %.1f MB\n", (REAL_T) total / (1024*1024)););
00215 
00216   return ptr;
00217 }
00218 
00219 
00220 void *realloc_with_check(void *ptr, size_t size){
00221   void *auxiliary_ptr = NULL;
00222 
00223   if (size == 0){ /* we allow NULL value for 'ptr' */ 
00224     FMB_error("In realloc_with_check(): size == 0 \n");
00225   }
00226 
00227   if ((auxiliary_ptr = my_realloc(ptr,size)) == NULL){
00228     FMB_perror("In realloc_with_check() ");
00229   }
00230   //  SEVERAL_PROCS_DEBUG_DISPLAY(2, fprintf(f_output, "total_mem_allocated = %.1f MB\n", (REAL_T) total / (1024*1024)););
00231 
00232   return auxiliary_ptr;
00233 }
00234 
00235 
00236 
00237 void *FMB_malloc(size_t size){
00238   if (size == 0){ 
00239     FMB_error("In FMB_malloc(): size == 0\n");
00240   }
00241   return my_malloc(size);
00242 }
00243 
00244 void *FMB_malloc_with_check(size_t size){
00245   return malloc_with_check(size);
00246 }
00247 
00248 void *FMB_calloc_with_check(size_t nmemb, size_t size){
00249   return calloc_with_check(nmemb, size);
00250 }
00251 
00252 void *FMB_realloc_with_check(void *ptr, size_t size){
00253   return realloc_with_check(ptr, size);
00254 }
00255 
00256 
00257 void FMB_free(void *ptr){
00258   my_free(ptr);
00259 }

00265 void FMB_error(const char *error_format, ...){
00266   va_list  ap;
00267 
00268   fprintf(stderr, "\n\n\t FMB error message: ");
00269 
00270   va_start(ap, error_format);
00271   vfprintf(stderr, error_format, ap);
00272   va_end(ap);
00273 
00274   fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00275   exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00276 }
00277 
00278 
00279 
00280 
00281 void FMB_perror(const char *error_format, ...){
00282   va_list  ap;
00283 
00284   va_start(ap, error_format);
00285   vsprintf(perror_mes, error_format, ap);
00286   va_end(ap);
00287 
00288   /* WARNING: 'perror()' is not thread-safe, which implies that DURING a call to 'perror()',
00289    * 'errno' can be changed by another thread (returning from another system call), and 
00290    * the "perror message" and the "errno value" displayed may not match!
00291    * 
00292    * In order to solve this problem, we use 'strerror()' with a mutex (here with FMB_thread_IO_lock())
00293    * (strerror_r() is not portable): this guarantees that the "perror message" and the "errno value" 
00294    * will match.   */ 
00295   fprintf(stderr,  "\n\n\t FMB error message: %s\n\t \"perror/errno\" message:%s\n", perror_mes, strerror(errno));
00296   
00297   exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00298 }
